### Read in SF trees data

```{r}
sf_trees <- read_csv(here("data", "sf_trees", "sf_trees.csv"))
```

## Basic Wrangling Reminders

refreash skills for data wrangling and summary statistics using funtions in `dplyr` package.

find the top 5 highest observations by legal_status, do some wrangling, make a graph

```{r}
top_5_status <- sf_trees %>% 
  count(legal_status) %>% 
  drop_na(legal_status) %>% 
  rename(tree_count = n) %>% 
  relocate(tree_count) %>% 
  slice_max(tree_count, n = 5)
```
